intro: Ixeris denticulata subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a low-growing perennial herb native to East Asia. It features a rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
